oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reproductive Benefits Associated with the use of ECP in Postpartum Dairy Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wagner, Denae
Sischo, William
Bondurant, Robert
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: estradiol cypionate
ECP
metritis
endometritis
reproductive benefits
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Use of estradiol cypionate (ECP) in postpartum dairy cattle currently receives much attention. The majority of ECP use is occurring in fresh cows either as an attempt to prevent uterine infection or as a part of a regime to treat cows with metritis or endometritis. Clinical data supporting the use of ECP in fresh cows has not been published. The object of this trial was to assess the reproductive benefits of using ECP in early postpartum dairy cows.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 166
